metadata.title: CVE-2021-21707 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
In PHP versions 7.3.x below 7.3.33, 7.4.x below 7.4.26 and 8.0.x below8.0.13, certain XML parsing functions, like simplexml_load_file(),URL-decode the filename passed to them. If that filename containsURL-encoded NUL character, this may cause the function to interpret this asthe end of the filename, thus interpreting the filename differently fromwhat the user intended, which may lead it to reading a different file thanintended.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-21707` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php8.1 - 8.1.0-1
libphp8.1-embed - 8.1.0-1
php8.1 - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-bcmath - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-bz2 - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-cgi - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-cli - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-common - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-curl - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-dba - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-enchant - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-fpm - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-gd - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-gmp - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-imap - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-interbase - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-intl - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-ldap - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-mbstring - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-mysql - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-odbc - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-opcache - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-pgsql - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-phpdbg - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-pspell - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-readline - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-snmp - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-soap - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-sqlite3 - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-sybase - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-tidy - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-xml - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-xsl - 8.1.0-1
php8.1-zip - 8.1.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: php8.1 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.1.0-1').
